t: The Thirsting Soul Satisfied in God.
A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
O*pn God, You are my God; I shall seek You earnestly; My*ln soul thirsts for You, my flesh yearns for You, In*ln a dry and weary land where there is no water.
Thus*ln I have seen You in the sanctuary, To*ln see Your power and Your glory.
Because*ln Your lovingkindness is better than life, My*ln lips will praise You.
So*ln I will bless You as long as I live; I*ln will lift up my hands in Your name.
My*ln soul is satisfied as with marrow and fatness, And*ln my mouth offers praises with joyful lips.
When*ln I remember You on my bed, I*ln meditate on You in the night watches,
For*ln You have been my help, And*ln in the shadow of Your wings I sing for joy.
My*ln soul clings to You; Your*ln right hand upholds me.
But*ln those who seek my life to destroy it, Will*ln go into the depths of the earth.
They*ln will be delivered over to the power of the sword; They*ln will be a prey for foxes.
But*ln the king will rejoice in God; Everyone*ln who swears by Him will glory, For*ln the mouths of those who speak lies will be stopped.
